title: Rules & Guidelines
description: Everything you need to know to participate in Company Spark hackathons successfully.

participation.eligibility: All company employees, contractors, and interns are welcome to participate
participation.teamSize: Teams of 2-5 members (individual participation also allowed)
participation.individuals: Solo participants will be matched with teams or can work independently

projectScope: Projects must address real business challenges or opportunities within our organization
Solutions should be feasible for implementation within 6-12 months
Projects can range from process improvements to new product features or entirely new business ideas
Integration with existing company systems and technologies is preferred but not mandatory
Open-source libraries and external APIs are permitted with proper licensing considerations

evaluationCriteria.description: Originality of the idea, creative problem-solving approach, and uniqueness of the solution
Technical soundness, scalability, and realistic implementation approach
Potential for positive business outcomes, ROI, and strategic alignment with company goals
Usability, accessibility, and overall experience design for end users
Clarity of communication, demonstration effectiveness, and team collaboration

codeOfConduct: Respect all participants regardless of background, experience level, or department
Collaborate openly and share knowledge to help everyone succeed
Maintain confidentiality of proprietary company information and trade secrets
Focus on constructive feedback and positive team dynamics
Report any inappropriate behavior or violations immediately to event organizers
All intellectual property developed during the hackathon belongs to the company
